description.narrative: IR 3.1 Child Protection EnvironmentPolicies, legal and administrative frameworks for protecting children from all forms of violence and for ensuring their access to protection services, including to justice, are strengthened and harmonized with the international treaties

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Alternative care reform and service provision
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs
Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Uganda United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Uganda 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Uganda 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Uganda 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 3.1 Child Protection EnvironmentPolicies, legal and administrative frameworks for protecting children from all forms of violence and for ensuring their access to protection services, including to justice, are strengthened and harmonized with the international treaties
#of planned, relevant,and appropriate laws, regulations, policies,sectoral plans integrating provisions on children's rights to protection.
A National Action Plan on Violence Against Children is approved by the MGLSD by 2012 and it is progressively being implemented all over the country by 2014

actual.value: 2015:National Action Plan on Violence against Children in Schools launched by the Minister of Education in August 2015, together with the Guidelines for Reporting Tracking Referral and Response (RTRR) for VACiS. The plan and guideline disseminated in all regions and being implemented in 10 pilot district

title.narrative: Mapping of the child protection system in Uganda completed and findings used to develop a Child Protection Strategy by 2014
Availability of tested innovative approaches for reduction of child marriage

target.value: 2015:National Strategy for abandonment of child marriage approved by the MGLSD

actual.value: 2015:National Strategy to end child marriage and teenage pregnancy launched on 16 June 2015 by the Hon Minister for Gender Labour and Social Development.
